Reviews.Title: “Vulcan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helen g
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the Vulcan Hotel for 1 night only, this was with a scoupon voucher. Very dingy looking from the outside, rooms average. 1 hour after our departure I was flabogasted by a phone call received by the Receptionist at the Vulcan to make us aware of a $200.00 incident debit they had already debited from our Credit Card due to the Servcie Staff noticing a strong smell of smoke comming from the room we had stayed in. I explained that we had not smoked in the room and had been out all night and only stayed in the room from 4.30am - 10am, and it could have been from us being in clubs through the night. This person, said he had already debited our card. I was flawed that he could debit $200.00 for a smell, no breakages, but a smell, I will never recommend or stay at this hotel again, I have never heard or experienced a hotel debiting your credit card of such an extreme amount for a smell that can not be proved that we directly smoked in the room, and we are non smokers... Maybe they should check out there ventalation, the room smelt on arival and the air conditioner does not work to it's full potential and makes noise when in use, and when you open the windows the traffic noise is such that you can not hear each other talk. I have asked for them to email me the contract we singed authorising debit of our credit card for incidents occurred and have not received this... Not Happy.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: burgerqueen700
Reviews.Content: Small room and tacky toliet. Room faced another window directly so had to keep the blinds closed all the time. Good thing was location-close to function centre and staff were friendly and helpful. Although bit annoyed that they take authorisation payment off credit card as well as payment when you settle your account so for the next few days or so you have paid them "double" the amount. bit annoying as was using debit card so could not use my money for couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with the Vulcan and staff.”
Reviews.Author: CherylLithgow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Vulcan Hotel. Our room was lovely and clean with a very comfortable queen bed. The bathroom may have been a little small but it served it's purpose. The hotel looks and feels very modern inside even though it is an old building. The staff were VERY helpful and polite. Our breakfast was very nice. Our room was on the 2nd floor and faced the courtyard, it was nice and quiet. Room, Wine and Breakfast, everything was great, thank you Vulcan staff for such a great weekend. The only problem that we had was getting a parking ticket whilst checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: k35_9
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hostel are small, but have everything you need. The fridge in the room was also very useful. The cafe serves a nice breakfast. Like everything else in Sydney, it's not cheap, but I think it gives a reasonable value for money compared to other places. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No ventilation. Falsely advertised.”
Reviews.Author: Leer3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from a friend's scoupon voucher. The room was not as advertised: 1) We were provided a standard double room on the ground floor instead of the deluxe room as advertised. 2) There was no bottle of wine upon arrival, as advertised. 3) The following day's breakfast was not as advertised on the scoupon voucher. The 'scrumptious' hot breakfast was simply two fried eggs on dry unbuttered turkish bread and bacon, without any sauce. In addition to this, the ground floor room (beneath street footpath level) had windows that did not open and air conditioning that turned itself off after an hour, which caused a very sleepless night. Cannot comment too much on the service, as we simply checked in and checked out the day afterwards. This is not a location if you are sightseeing in Sydney, but rather if you have specific business in the Ultimo area. The rooms are modern, quite clean and well maintained. Overall, I was dissatisfied with my stay. I have no sympathy for any establishment that collaborates with discount websites to draw business and severely underdeliver on the day. It is only because my stay was free that I did not bother to make a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Graceful_Warrior
Reviews.Content: Staid here one night with work colleagues. My room was on the inside of the building. It was removed from the nosie of the surrounding streets and looked out onto the internal courtyard which is quite nice. However a group was sitting in their smoking. They could see straight into my room so I had NO PRIVACY and had to draw the blinds. I was booked into a non smoking room. Unfortunately it smelt of smoke. Unfortunately 1 of my colleagues had a room on the ground floor on the outside of the building. This was definately not noise free! Sirens, rubbish trucks, passing traffic and drunk people passing by have loud conversations... throughout the night.... subsequently she had little sleep. It is an old building in a good location. The owners have done some interesting things to funk it up. Rooms are a reasonable size. Plenty of hot water. Nice and clean. Like most old buildings you can hear the water pipes in action in the bathroom. Recommend sleeping with the bathroom door closed. Internet available for $10/day. Breakfast available from 8 am so not great for business travellers. Cafe looked fantastic, nice design. No iron in your room. One per floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: meistarlemon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute as emergency accommodation because my new apartment wasn't ready yet. I booked a standard double but was upgraded to a luxury triple. Rahman at reception was really friendly, gave great directions and free wifi! The rooms were beautiful and clean. The location is amazing, just a short walk to Chinatown but in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “A little scuffed around the edges, but comfortable & pleasant hotel, conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: AntiquesOnTour
Reviews.Content: We discovered this modern-ised ex-pub whilst searching the net for post-SADE concert accommodation. Their web site made everything look modern & enticing. However, heritage buildings such as this are notoriously expensive to renovate & maintain, so we made allowances for that. Staff very welcoming & friendly. Undercover parking only 2 minutes walk away & economical for city parking. Location is excellent for walking to Entertainment Centre, China Town & Darling Harbour precincts, with buses only 2 blocks away for the city itself. Premium room was quite large with plenty of storage and everything you need. Bathroom small but adequate and clean. Our room (202) was over Wattle Street and noisy with windows open, but room has double glazing and air con, so not a problem when we closed the windows. We would book this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel, Great Staff and Service! Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: annawesnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011, we were shown to our room by the proprietor who was very welcoming and knowledgable of local tourist attractions and restaurants. The room was nicely decorated with a spacious balcony, large flatscreen TV and plenty of storage space. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful and the breakfast was superb. We thought the hotel was excellent value for money and would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Boss' needs come first...”
Reviews.Author: bromley8
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very friendly, room was adequate, although on the small side, was a bit on the noisy side, both from inside and out (fronts onto a main road). Very convienently located. Biggest annoyance was the fact the owner (although a very pleasant lady) lived in but chose to take her breakfast, in the main dining room at the same time as all the guests every morning, so the staff were evidently more intent on keeping her happy and catering to her every need rather than the paying guests who played second fiddle and had to wait for their turn in line!!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get, good location”
Reviews.Author: NuzSubs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the weekend 26 Nov 2011 and it turned out to be okay for the price we paid. The rooms are quite tiny, the windows are quite small so not much natural light in the rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful, however there was no staff member at the desk past 10pm and no one returned until post 8am. It is a very old building but newly renovated. Location was pretty good, only 10 min walk to darling harbour. There is no parking for this hotel, there is a parking company's parking lot they use which is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: buffie46
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 1 night (Scoopon voucher Thursday 3rd Nov) When I booked I asked a young man if there was a balcony room & was told there was only 1 balcony room & he would write a request on my booking for this room. I phoned a couple of weeks later to check if my booking was marked for the balcony room & was told it wasn't but she (Christine) would mark my booking for the balcony room. I phoned the night before to check again & was told by another lady that the owners were occupying the balcony room as they were doing renovations?? She then put me through to Christine who confirmed I was booked into the balcony room????? Total confusion! On arrival (early) I was greeted by Christine who was very pleasant & advised my room was ready, nice room 2 double/queen beds, good size room & ensuite, large screen TV & a balcony. Downside is the parking (a block away) but Christine suggested we leave our luggage in the foyer & then park the car which we did. Breakfast the next morning was very confusing, staff didn't advise if we helped ourselves to the buffet or to take a seat & they would give us a menu, so I had to ask if we ordered at the kitchen window or at the counter & was told I COULD give my order to the person behind counter.....OR WHAT?? We both ordered bacon & eggs, over easy & they came out sunny side up VERY runny we had to send them back. All in all I would not stay here again I am glad I didn't pay full freight. It wasn't horrible as the room was nice & comfortable but in need of a dusting on TV remote, side tables etc. Christine was the only saving grace. Great German Restaurant & Beer Cafe just around the corner in Broadway (turn right off Wattle)

Reviews.Title: “Neat, convenient and courteous”
Reviews.Author: gin_boon81
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a great find, close to central station. Also has a nice cafe which can cater for gluten free. The staff are all very helpful and friendly. Good value for Sydney. Only minor point is that rooms are not that big.

Reviews.Title: “A suprising gem”
Reviews.Author: enneiviv
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a special deal. I wasn't expecting too much but the 'original facade' of this boutique hotel was hiding a modern, clean and quite upmarket secret. Renovations are still happening but not at times that would impact on your stay. The hotel is in an older area of Sydney but is close to Sydney Uni, CBD, RPA Hospital, restaurants and public transport. If you are looking for panoramic views, this is not the hotel to chose but it certainly ticks all the other boxes for a great stay. Staff are lovely and a modern cafe is next to reception. Parking is also available a short walking distance away. I would highly recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cartay_11
Reviews.Content: this is a lovley little hotel, with great breakfast options, very central to the City and a few mins from Darling Harbour, lovely helpful staff and plesant rooms. Nicley decorated, showers need an upgrade and the parking is a bit of a walk but in generla great find!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable updated old-style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stratfd
Reviews.Content: About ten minutes walk from Central station, the Vulcan is an older building (converted inner-city pub). Room not large, but big enough, nice thick walls, no noise from the neighbors. Bed comfortable, room also has desk and table, nice original fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: ekidna6
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed here for two nights over a weekend recently and we were pleasantly surprised. We intended to be out of our room for most of the time, apart from sleeping, and this place was ideal. We booked a standard room, which was on ground floor at rear of hotel, and it was fairly small, but it was clean, had a comfortable bed, and a generous size bathroom which was also clean. (Shower head was good also, not one of those "fine-jet, run around to get wet" types). Due to the size of the room, there was no table and chairs to eat at, but the staff were very welcoming of us eating some take-away food in the front eatery area. The room had thick brick walls, and was fairly quiet, apart from a street sweeper which came around on Monday morning, but I am sure he wouldn't come every day. Breakfast was very nice, and relatively cheap, and served in the front of the hotel in the eating area. The staff were the most welcoming I have encountered for a very long time, and nothing seemed to be a problem for them. They were great at check-in, great for local information, and really made a good stay, a fantastic stay. The Vulcan is a short stroll away from Darling Harbour, and we felt safe walking through to there at night. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would highly recommend The Vulcan to my family and friends for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Ask the question...which way to the Holodeck?”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: The Vulcan Hotel is a recently refurbished hotel in a converted 19th century pub. Although it is aiming for the boutique moniker it lacked any posters of a certain pointy-eared man which seems illogical, or is this the Romulan Hotel? Room 12 was a Queen Superior room on level 2 with generous floor space & large window facing the courtyard. All furnishings were of a modern design with mood lighting pre-set at a dim level with main lighting from the bedside lamps. LCD TV, DVD player, clock/radio & Foxtel. Large refurb bathroom but the vanity was small as a motels. Shower was large enough for 2 small shower head. There were no blankets only thin bedsheets but the linen was of good quality. Overall the room was nice & probably missing a padded lounge, holodeck or a day bed next to the window just to complete the boutique feel. The hotel exterior seems to be in the Federation style perhaps (no pun intended) & is more modern than boutique but still comfortable. It is visually a nice building typical of the old Sydney town & located in an area not too deep into the Sydney CDB. Street parking is possible & getting in & out of Sydney is easy.The hotel has a new elevator but a particle transporter would be faster especially during busy periods. The budget category description is true for Sydney prices but I wouldnt pay more than our internet rate which included a simple breakfast in the hotel cafe & a bottle of wine on arrival which logically pleased us all for under $130....& just for the record, Captain Picard is much much better than Kirk.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....not great....but overpriced!! Beware the word "boutique".”
Reviews.Author: GuitarmanBowral
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here overnight to attend a nearby function. The location is quite handy to the city and nearby suburbs. Our standard double was pretty basic with interesting painter's Texta colour markings on the walls and doors where they are obviously intending to do some painting sometime soon. As we were to spend only limited time in the room all we needed was a good bed and shower. Both were disappointing. The bed was very average with thin blankets. We had a terrible sleep despite room 103 being reasonably quiet and dark. The shower was not what you would call a power shower. Very weak! All of the above comes at the hefty price of $169 room only and $18 for parking which is not on site but in the UTS carpark, a block away. On the upside, the only staff member we dealt with was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed. This is not a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller201111
Reviews.Content: The Vulcan is in a great location, it's close to the city and close to all the places we wanted to go. Apart from that we were really quite disappointed. We found one staff member to be friendly (thanks Lisa). Everything seemed to be a great ordeal or too hard for the other staff members, no matter how small our request. Our room could have done with a good vacuum and our request for extra sheets was ignored. Also be aware this hotel is undergoing restoration, so don't expect to be able to rest throughout the day or after the workmen start. So all in all, we still had a great holiday but our accomodation was definitely not what we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Anitajahn
Reviews.Content: I arrived early around 8.30 after a 24hr flight, not expecting to get into my room and was so pleased to be offered a room to freshen up in whilst mine was prepared. The manager Gary was so friendly and helpful as was the other receptionist. I stayed there with my backpacking son and we both appreciated all the assistance we were given, printing off our boarding passes etc. The hotel is within a short bus ride to downtown Sydney, the wi fi was free, amazing, and a local bar within a short walk away. A fabulous experience and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: VivaDarwin
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in a twinshare on the ground floor. Once we closed the window the street noise was almost completely blocked. The room was small with two single beds, a bedside table for each, a share cupboard, draws and a desk. The bathroom was clean but obviously not much privacy with such a small room. We stayed 2 nights, I would recommend a bigger room for a longer stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful, during our stay we dealt with 3 different reception staff and all of them knew their stuff and were able to direct us to where we wanted to go, even downloading a google map for us. The hotel was a 10- 15 min walk from the powerhouse museum, darling harbour etc. The hotel does not have a restaurant, you can get breakfast but not dinner, we ate at an italian place just down the street which was good. You can get food delivered to the hotel if you want. I had no problems with this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JamesArabiaFelix
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a very nice part of the city (pub and mall near, as well at the University of Sydney; good access to downtown also). Clean, modern rooms (although mine was a bit small) with nice tea and coffee set and good wifi signal. The front desk is only manned during the day and evening, but staff are available at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bmcgreevy
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone and very one. I wa suppose to stay at this hotel on the 9-10 of febuary however had book it for the 9-10 of march. Unfortuanlety the hotel was full book so I was unable to stay. However the receptionist Gary O was absolutely amazing he book us into another hotel and organized transport and also rebooked as for another hotel in July. Just want to let every one know how amazing Gary was and that if you are staying in Sydney to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “the best family owned Boutique hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: KingfisherSydney
Reviews.Content: very warm welcome when i walk in to the hotel feels like i am at home, check in was quick. very nice Boutique hotel, 5 min walk to shopping centre also 5 min to bus stop. Location is very very good... The best thing about this place is free internet , i been around not much hotel offer free internet...

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mooster5
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights. The staff were generally very helpful, especially the male receptionist. We were on the top floor (4th) but the lift wasn't working, making it hard work to carry our luggage, but I guess it's just one of those things. Our room was meant to be superior but I wouldn't call it that really. The shower was awful, it was quite painful on the skin, I wouldn't mind if it was because it was a power shower, far from it! It might possibly be the worst shower I've experienced! On arrival our room was unbearably hot & took a while to cool down with the air con, but at least it had it! Good location for both Darling Harbour & Sydney Harbour. 15 min walk to Darling Harbour & 5 min walk to bus stop for Sydney Harbour. Around the corner from Sydney Central train station

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: franck12
Reviews.Content: It's hard to know where to start describing how dreadful this hotel is. I booked on the strength of a recommendation to stay in Darling Harbour and an upbeat review in Lonely Planet. I arrived mid evening after a very early start in Uluru with high hopes. Settle into my comfortable room, a drink at the bar, maybe something to eat and a short stroll round the neighbourhood. Some hopes My room was small and dark, but I was upgraded because no-one had noticed the leaking fridge. There was nothing to eat and no bar (unless you count the communal vending machine). A dismal walk in the neighbourhood revealed, in every direction, nothing but dark empty streets with a few cheap takeaways. Next day I discovered getting anywhere on foot from the hotel was problematic. It claims you can get to the town hall in 10 minutes. My walk back from there took about 40 with frequent stops to ask the way, the discovery that the direct route on the hotel map wasn't possible, and that even the indirect one took me through pedestrian unfriendly areas and dead ends. Walking to the Central Station (also a promised 10 minutes) proved less difficult but took 20 minutes. The reception closes at 10.00 pm, uniquely in my experience of many much cheaper than this one. It's also indifferent service without a smile from staff who double with other duties, so expect a wait even during 'staffed hours'. When I left I was overcharged for use of the drinks vending machine; something which wasn't checked with me before I paid, and which I was initially told I'd have to take up with the machine's operator. It was only after I insisted that I shouldn't take a hit for a mistake that wasn't mine that the excess was deducted from my bill. I've stayed in worse hotels but never anywhere that so spectacularly fails to live up to its publicity. Because of that it deserves only one star. Probably fine for a single person travelling by car or taxi on expenses and attending the Convention Centre. For anyone else avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Central and economical”
Reviews.Author: potblak
Reviews.Content: Situated within walking distance of great restaurants and the CBD. Rooms are smallish but clean and comfortable. Parking is reasonable using the Hotel's special rates at the nearby (3min walk) parking garage. Breakfast is good and well cooked.

Reviews.Title: “A forgetable experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pendulum77
Reviews.Content: Unhelpful evening staff. 6.30pm no staff for 15 minutes. Waiting on the road. Tiny room. Can hear people upstairs flushing the toilet and showering. Plumbing sounded like it was leaking ? That was loud. Internet speed average. Bed worn out. Cleanliness ok. Is on a one way street, good luck trying to find it. Parking facility is too far away and again staff unhelpful in explaining parking. The parking keypad was missing the X pad and made it hard to open the doors. That was a debarcle. A real average experience. A dingy hotel. Last one left on the internet, so we thought to give it a try. I now know why it was the last one left.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel in a boring area”
Reviews.Author: sunkist_michelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel would only be acceptable for low-budget travellers. Unfortunately due to travelling at an extremely busy time, I had no option but to stay here on a business trip - at $350/night! Ridiculous. No hotel restaurant for a hungry traveller at night - only a dismal looking breakfast in the morning. I wore my thongs in the shower because it looked so dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, relatively central location”
Reviews.Author: tbyrd3080
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel same day for about $90/night. Took airport shuttle to the hotel (20 min). We were able to check-in early, which was nice. Front desk staff wasn't the most friendly, but cordial enough. The room itself was nice, fairly large. We had a queen/twin bed combo. The bathroom is nice; the shower is set up such that the floor pretty much gets drenched, plus there's no fan in the bathroom so it gets really steamy. This was not a big deal for us. The room was clean and served our purposes well. We had to make a bit of a hike to get to the closest rail station, but it's only about a 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour; hardly an inconvenience. The location also seemed safe, but we never came in later than 10:30 PM (plus we are two guys, but I wouldn't see a female walking back being a problem). Our package didn't include free breakfast, but there was a restaurant in the hotel that offered breakfast (it seemed a little pricey to us). The hotel offers power adapters for rent (no charge). We had to pay for the wireless internet, which wasn't exactly cheap. Overall a good experience; I would certainly stay here again but would probably expect to pay a little less if I booked it with more notice.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice Design Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: FedericoC
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Vulcan last year in February and I was really impressed!!! Lovely decorated large rooms, helpful staff,really nice and elegantbar and restaurant!!!I will be back for sure next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - misleading.”
Reviews.Author: Kittyfeet
Reviews.Content: Room rates were affordable at $100.00 per night, but the room photo on website was misleading - not taken care of very well and TINY!- corrugated metal ceiling, cracks in the walls, blinds were falling apart, the internet was indeed only $10.00 per stay but you can't access anything that needs to download - takes 5 minutes per item!! Also whatever disinfectant they use to clean it smells awful - like the stuff they use in low-end places in Mexico. The walls are so thin you can hear EVERYTHING going on in rooms around you and the hallway. Hallway carpets are stained, honestly after checking in I thought of just going somwhere else. There is also only 6 channels on the tv, 3 of which only show sport. Also bedside lamps didn't work. You can get better hotels for the same price. Pretty far away from everything too. Lots of walking. Breakfast was good though, and the staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_Tan626
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel from the airport, the receptionist was friendly. Explained to us how to get to the hotel and best way to get to the hotel. When we reached there, we found the hotel was very cozy and clean. The environment in the hotel was very quite and comfortable. Since it was the first time we traveled to Sydney, the receptionist showed us the places of interest which we can go by walking. The hotel is very near to China Town, Darling Harbour and etc etc. A+ for the good service and the comfortable hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: LCDaMan
Reviews.Content: It's a decent enough place - clean, with fridge, rooms are kind of small. But it's a bit of a hike away from the Opera House/Harbour Bridge area, it's even 20 minutes to Darling Harbour, where we went our first night. At $145 AUD/night, it's too expensive for the location and for what you get in the room. The on-site restaurant is pretty pricey, too, but there's inexpensive places on Broadway, just three blocks away. The neighborhood is nothing special, but I never felt unsafe, and we were out pretty late a couple of nights. If I had it to do over, I'd get a place closer to the Rocks, even for more $$.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong really.....”
Reviews.Author: KeithFM
Reviews.Content: Pretty well located, especially for Central Station. Lovely compact hotel. Rooms not big but nicely presented and good bath/shower rooms. Internet was only $10 for five days! Icing on the cake was the restaurant, the Hummingbird, where you have breakfast ($12 for coffee 2X eggs + toast), have a meal their one night - it'll save you shlepping out. Great food and value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good-sized room”
Reviews.Author: otagotraveller
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Vulcan, and would stay there again. Our first choice would have been somewhere a little closer to George St, but it was a busy weekend in Sydney and those places had been taken. Even still, the Vulcan is a reasonable 15-min walk to the Central Station part of town, not too bad. There was one problem - the air-conditioner in our first room did not work. But, staff gave us a choice of 3 other rooms, and, in the end, gave us an upgrade to a really nice large room on the top floor. The receptionist went to a lot of trouble to help us out - even though, granted, the air-conditioner shouldn't have been broken in the first place. The rooms we saw were tastefully furnished, our bed was comfortable, the bathroom nice, and the breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was great. I see the other reviews of the Vulcan are really variable, but we were really happy with our experience here.

Reviews.Title: “A Basic Hotel 20 mins walk from Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: westhills
Reviews.Content: The Vulcan is not in a very nice area and there is no where around the Hotel to have a stroll in the evenings. Darling Harbour is a good 20 minute walk, 1st past the Power House Museum then Paddy's Market monorail station, and then still a good walk after that. I agree about the outside space at the Hotel - if it rains it's un- useable - sofas were wet through. Also only one door was usually open to it, and that was around the other side to where our room was. Room was small, and the 1st night the air conditioning was noisy and kept us awake all night. The bar was not inviting, and we weren't even tempted by the food on offer. However, we almost "got used to it" and enjoyed exploring Paddy's Market, Chinatown etc. from the Hotel, and also used the Monorail from Paddys Market station. You have to walk a way for a bottle shop, so that you can at least have a drink in your room!!!! Recommend "Hannah's Pies" on the way to station. The price is reasonable, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very misleading web page......”
Reviews.Author: ChrzaszczAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights and found it far off from what their web site promised. 1/ Staff took care of our luggage and let us in before check in time, that I give them 2/ Found room with one chair, corrugated ceiling (!), scratchy blankets 3/ Advertised minibar fridge was in fact mini fridge if to discount jar of chilled water and tabs of cream for your coffee. 4/ Airconditioner did not work in heating mode, only cooling 5/ Double bed supported by a brick at one corner (!) 6/ Interior finish very rough and cheap 7/ Bathroom having no shelves for customer's toiletries, just one tiny glass one under the mirror. Had to keep our things on the floor 8/ Bath tub/shower curtain wrapping around us when showering was not impressive. Water everywhere... 9/ Advertised "Court yard resting area" looking pretty much like a lobby was good only on the pictures. It was raining during our stay and since it had no cover or roof, the whole area was out of action. There was no other place to congregate unless one wanted to explore the bistro. 10/ Bistro invited customers for "DINNER" (as seen on their web site and on signs in the rooms) but one had to take the menu to hand to see what does "dinner" mean to them. It was in fact "Tapoz" (Tapas?) - serve sizes of entrees but prices like for a dinner..... Possibly the only ones trying their dinners were first timers like us. There was nobody else there but us when we had that "dinner". 11/ Staff was friendly though, possibly trying to compensate for all that... 12/ In order to survive, we were leaving as soon as we could and coming back when it was late. There was nothing else to do in that hotel and its surroundings did not really invite for a walk after dark Generally speaking it was one bad experience - never again in that place

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Melb_Mel
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed pleasant enough until my partner and I reached the room. We had requested a non-smoking room. The room smelt of smoke, it was even in the sheets and blankets. There were no toiletries when we first entered the room. We had to leave the hotel soon after checking in. Before we did we went to the front desk to ask them to spray the room as the smoke smell was rather strong. We returned to the hotel just before 10pm. Our room key did not open the guest entrance. When we got to our room again all they had done was open a window. They had put soap and shampoo in the bathroom but no toilet paper. There was no phone numbers for us to request some. The web site stated there was a mini bar. It was in hall way and you had to have a smart key from reception but by this time it was closed. The bed was on wheels and would move ever time you rolled over in bed.Every time someone flushed the toilet or had a shower you could hear it through the walls. House keeping woke us up at 7.30am the next morning. At 8am they decided to enter our room even thought we had requested a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: babywine7
Reviews.Content: Overall, my stay was rather disappointing, and very different from what was at the hotel's website: 1.Room not made up when checking in 2. Airconditioning failed hence couldn't sleep as it was freezing; though I have to commend the prompt response of the staff when told next morning 3. Cold room and atmosphere, more a budget accomodation than boutique hotel 4. Towels not delivered to room though requested for and promised 5. Receptionist rude and sacastic 6. Did not charge prices as agreed 7. Not that near to Darling Harbour. It's at least a good 20 mins walk to Darling Harbour. 8. In the middle of an industrial estate hence very quiet at night and weekends. 9. Not near food places or convenience stores.

Reviews.Title: “Vulcan Website is Misleading”
Reviews.Author: AllisonKayAnne
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online and booked directly with the hotel based on the pictures and description of the hotel on their website. When we arrived at the hotel I sat for a good 30 seconds inside the taxi, not wanting to get out because there was no recognition of the hotel from the photos I had seen on the internet. The hotel is drab, the furnishings are cheap, the rooms are cramped and the atmosphere is unpleasant. All of this would be ok, if we A) had expected the conditions to be poor and B) the price reflected the conditions. The hotel is barely more than a backpackers in terms of the comforts provided and should not be marketed as a boutique motel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Chic - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tiff73
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at The Vulcan Hotel last weekend. Had a great time in Sydney as I always do. The hotel is very fashionable and very hip! The rooms are great and new all the things I would expect with a boutique hotel nice decor and it gives you this great feeling as soon as you enter the place. Staff are great and very helpful and really personal service, like the good old days.

Reviews.Title: “Robbery”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTravellor
Reviews.Content: I had over $1500 worth of property stolen from my room in the middle of the night ... I wasn't the only one either! Numerous rooms were robbed. I would never stay there ever again i would never recommend this hotel to anyone and i still have no idea where my property is the hotel didn't help a bit. They blamed me for it and somehow didn't know how to check the security camera tapes! Mystery! The rooms are lock and key so there is no trace of how the apparent robber got in. The hotel "out of goodwill" offered me $100. The room was great but after the extremely bad service i recieved ..... All i can do is warn you if you do stay there LOCK EVERYTHING AWAY!! Oh and there isn't a safe anyway! It may be cheap but trust me having to replace house keys,car keys,work keys, all your bank cards, reading glasses, precious jewellery... having you plane tickets stolen and finding out 1/2 an hour before your flight .. IS NOT WORTH IT!!! I would much rather pay $50 more anywhere else but the VULCAN!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: firstclassboy
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Vulcan hotel on a Thursday and Friday as i was in sydney for business meetings. The Superior room i got was very modern, well furnished for my perposes and also had wireless internet in the rooms. Staff are very very helpfull and the breakfast in the cafe in the hotel is TO DIE FOR !!!! also they do a great coffee !!! VERY well prices for a hotel that is a 10 minute walk to cenral station and darling harbour !!! Had to get a better price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: CaptBrian
Reviews.Content: Not so young traveller.... Scarborough England. I arrived late in the evening after a very long day, the night porter booked me into my room very quickly, which was very clean and tidy. Throughout my 3 day stay I found the staff very helpful and friendly, If I ever visit Sydney again it will certainly be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect to much”
Reviews.Author: SopranoBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vulcan for 2 days in Feb this year, we had viewed the photos on its website, which I must say are very misleading and the description of a "boutique hotel" within easy access to darling harbour is a bit ambitious This is a very old building that has been refurbed on the cheap. the rooms are small and cold with corrugated steel ceilings our parents room had damp up the walls, the blankets were scratchy and the carpets are threadbare, the location is in the middle of a very busy industrial area, our room overlooked a classroom full of children, and it is a very unpleasant 20 min walk to Darling Harbour, and it was the kind of hotel that you wanted to spend as little time in as possible as it had a cold empty atmosphere. This is a hotel that is best suited for people who just want a bed for the night, definatley not recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: eduardocam
Reviews.Content: Simple Hotel, all you need when you're 10-15 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Gather building work in 2006 caused bad reviews. Helpful staff and Carole, the owner, was particularly friendly to everyone. Only fault to find, the sheets should have been changed at shorter intervals.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: Laceytreigh
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard double for a 2 night stay, $139 AUD per night which was probably a bit much for what it was. A pub in a former life, the room was small, but the bed was queen size and very comfy. Opening windows were double glazed, bathroom new with shower over bath, exhaust fan didn't seem to do much. A/C unit in wall, not through window, so very quiet operation, remote controlled. Small fridge, tea and coffee making in room. There is a lift now. Didn't feel unsafe to walk around after dark, 5-10 min walk to Haymarket, i.e. Paddy's market, monorail and light rail station, Chinatown, bit further same direction to the Spanish Quarter, bit further still to Darling Harbour. Didn't eat on site, but nice meal at the Chinese place round in Mary Ann st, don't let the look put you off, the food was excellent. Food court above Paddy's Market good for $7 breakfast. If you just want somewhere to put your head for the night, this place isn't bad, handy to lots of places and very quiet when we were there. Non-smoking indoors, there is a central courtyard for smokers, which is decked out with comfy outdoor furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again.”
Reviews.Author: Orioness
Reviews.Content: Thought I was in luck when I reached the Hotel because they could check me in straight away at 9am as opposed to 2pm and I really, really needed sleep. I had however expected to find the room to the same standard I would have had I checked in at 2pm. But then again, judging by my experiences over the 5 days, perhaps I had found it the same. If I hadn't already paid in full, I would have left and found another hotel immediately. It was so not like on the website. The room was the size of my master bedroom/study here at home. That includes the bathroom. No welcome kit (you know with the phone numbers and paper and pen and maps etc). It smelt unbearably of cigarette smoke, the blanket had stains on it and the wall had hand smear marks. I think I cried. There wasn't even a shower curtain. When I queried this later thinking they may have just forgotten to put one up, I believe I was told that's how they clean the bathroom. I thought they were joking but they never did put a curtain up. Water EVERYWHERE every time I took a shower. I'm surprised I didn't electrocute myself. Oh and talking about safety? I realised on the last day that the fire evacuation poster on the back of the door was for a different room than mine. There were little cards to place in the bathroom and on the bed indicating when you'd like the towels and/or sheets changed. I had however expected the bed to be made even if the sheets weren't changed. I also found on at least one occasion that the maid had entered the room when I hadn't put the sign on the door. It was the day I hadn't locked all my bits and pieces in the suitcase so I wasn't particularly happy with this. The soundproofed windows aren't too bad but the walls are thin so if you have tv watching neighbours invest in some good ear plugs. I found that on the rare occasions the reception staff actually acknowledged me entering or leaving the hotel they were either disinterested or cheeky/sarcastic and quite unhelpful. This was not the way I wanted to be treated when travelling alone. It's hard enough being in a strange place without the place you're staying being a nightmare. I have nicer facilities at home for a third of the price per night . Maybe next time I plan a holiday I'll stay home!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and value at the Vulcan”
Reviews.Author: radames
Reviews.Content: I moved to the Vulcan after a bad experience at Pensione Hotel. The staff at the Vulcan were helpful, holding a room for me while i negotiated my way out of Pensione (which was really lousy). The room was large and peaceful with comfortable minimalist furnishings, a discreet little kitchenette and a large sunny balcony with furniture. If you hate aircon as I do, you can sleep with the doors wide open. The facade is heritage but the rooms have been substantially rebuilt. The hotel is slightly off the main drag, but only a couple of minutes walk from the monorail stop and Powerhouse Museum. There were good Malaysian resturants on the same block, and 5 minutes to Chinatown. It was extremely good value for $A110,

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the service”
Reviews.Author: dcjdenver
Reviews.Content: I booked a premium double room for one week. When I arrived, it was very hot and humid in Sydney. I checked into my room around 2:00 pm on a Sunday and told the desk clerk the air conditioning wasn't working in my room. She didn't have another premium room for the price I paid. She showed me a regular room with two twin beds that was lower priced than my room and said I could change but would have to pay the same price. She also suggested she give me a humidifier to cool the room until the maintenance crews could check out the air conditioner on Monday. The twin room was too small for 2 people so I chose the humidifier. It didn't cool the room at all and I was miserably hot all night. The next morning I asked for some ice for the humidifier so I could cool the room enough to shower. The desk clerk said I could go to the Shell station across the street and buy some. Another desk clerk suggested I pay $30 more a night for an upgraded room. Since I was so hot and miserable I said ok and that I would speak to a manager about the rate. I spoke to the manager and told him I didn't think it was fair that they charge me more for an upgraded room when the premium room I booked was not available. He didn't agree and charged my credit card. The rooms are small and clean in this hotel. However, don't expect good service or special treatment. The superior room we eventually received was large and new but I think you can find a better location and hotel for the price. The hotel says its in Darling Harbour however, it is a 15 minute walk to the Harbour. I would not recommend staying in this hotel if you can afford something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UKFlaxy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on a recent trip to Oz, it is a boutique hotel on Wattle Street, only 15 min walk to Darling Harbour. The hotel was clean at at such reasonable rates AU$99.00 per night was great value. The staff were friendly and my room although small was clean and comfortable with AC TV and fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: JamesQuinn
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at Vulcan Hotel for New Years Eve I found the place to be a nice place. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We had to stay 4 night as this was the minmum stay and the rate was quite high but i guess Sydney is at this time of year. It looks like the renovations have finished and the place looks very new.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, pretty good deal and location”
Reviews.Author: DebN
Reviews.Content: Booked on wotif.com around 3 weeks before my arrival. Got a $89 AUS rate for a single room. Pros: Good rate for a room with a jacuzzi tub. My friend got a shower in his room but a fireplace instead. Safe area and clean rooms. Liked having a fridge and hot water for tea in the room. Chinatown and Paddy's Market is a 15 minute walk. Cons: A weird thing about the room, you have to put your key holder in a slot to activate the lights and AC. When you leave the room, all electricity is turned off except for the fridge. When you return, you have to reset you clock radio. Cafe was still under renovation, so no breaky downstairs but there are places to eat around a block away. Have to walk to the main road for buses. Central train station is a 15-20 minute walk up a hill. A pain with luggage and they don't have a hotel shuttle. Location is off the main road, a two block walk. There is an internet cafe around 4 blocks away and a large indoor mall, no public access computers for hotel patrons inside hotel. The staff''s customer service was a hit or miss depending on who you got to help you. On Waddle Street, you hear some traffic noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Location...location...location”
Reviews.Author: Paxo-01
Reviews.Content: Vulcan advertises itself as being in Darling Harbour bet be warned .. its not! The bus service is not far away, but Sydneys roads are clogged all the time, the walk to the monorail is some 10 - 15 minutes, as is the walk to the train (tube) Darling Harbour itself is some 15 - 20 minutes walk away. We experienced a problem with blocked fire exits which the staff cared not about. Fortunately the owner overheared my complaint and dealt with it. The renevation work is still going on and seemingly will be for some time.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: JamesUK007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vulcan Hotel recently and found it to be quite a nice hotel. My room was a nice size room and clean and comfortable. There was some renovation going on in the ground floor cafe but I was not disturbed by it. The service was great and very refreshing from most hotels. I arrived at 8am in the morning and reception allowed me to check in early, very nice after a 24 hour flight.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of renovation work”
Reviews.Author: Applebaum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vulcan Hotel for three nights from 17-19 July and encountered various problems mainly due to the renovation work taking place. Despite booking directly through the hotel we were not forewarned that building work was taking place. On arrival we discovered one wall of the hotel was completely missing making the entire building freezing. The room aircon/heater did not work meaning we were alternately boiling and freezing all night. Our room was not cleaned during our three night stay, at times there was no hot water, then no water at all, the mini bar did not work due to the builders cutting through the power supply and the bathroom fan did not work. The Vulcan is a nice enough hotel, and will have an elevator once the renovation is complete. We did receive a $50 refund once we complained on departure. It is handy for Glebe, to which it is a lot closer than Darling Harbour but its location on a busy road does not make it an ideal choice.

Reviews.Title: “Our Summer in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in the charming Vulcan Hotel. Our friends stayed there years ago and the said to give it a try. We did expect such a lovley place for the rate we paid, well worth every cent! So close to everything. We really enjoyed Sydney and we hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “not again!”
Reviews.Author: eagleeye73
Reviews.Content: location not bad 20min walk to darling harbour,the vulcan is a listed building so no lifts which may not be a problem for some but when you are woken up with suitcases banging on every step in the morning it`s no joke,the rooms are very small the fridge is half the size of the bed,bed sheets did not get changed for 3 days it`s a very grey hotel,meaning it just drians you being there we spent as little time as poss there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: traveller1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Vulcan over Christmas 2005. We were happy on the whole and thought it was quite good value but can see where some of the negative reviews might be coming from. On the plus side it cost Aus $120 a night, was not far from the city centre, rooms were pretty new and quite well equipped. You can walk to Darling Harbour in around 15 minutes or there is a very frequent bus service with a bus stop just a few minutes away with buses to Circular Quay, George St and the main train station. There is also a shopping centre nearby so you can buy breakfast and picnic stuff (there is a fride in the room, as in most Australian hotels). It is true that there aren't really any restaurants nearby but there are a couple of take aways and the shopping centre has lots of cafes and a food court. If you wanted to go to a proper restaurant you's probably be looking at Darling Harbour. It's also true that the area is not particularly attractive, but it didn't seem dangerous and we were not uncomfortable walking at night. It was very quiet (the room was on a side street) but it's true there's no lift. The room itself was fine but the only thing we were not too happy about was the service - the reception was closed after about 9.00 pm till 7.00 am and on Christmas Day there was no maid service. Then the next day the maid knocked on the door at 10.00am when we were still in the room. We went out at 11.00am but when we came back that night they hadn't cleaned the room. We thought of it more as a luxury hostel than an international style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience; never find a worst location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel!!! Didn't sleep all the night. I booked a month earlier asking for a room not on the main road. They gave me a room on the main road. I didn't sleep all the night. Breakfast was poor and very expensive. Pay attention!! you pay for every peace you eat!!! They are not very kind. My suggestion: Go to the Novotel, nearer to the centre, better and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel....Perfect in every way...Great rooms, Great location.....Great Staff.....Great breakfast...Great Price

Reviews.Title: “Not a big fan!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a particularly good hotel at all. In a decidedly crappy part of town - once night falls don't even think about walking anywhere. Claims to be 5 minutes walk from Darling Harbour are well exaggerated - probably closer to 15 mins walk. The hotel does not offer cable TV as it claims - and the television it does have has incredibly poor reception. No nearby restaurants or even crappy takeaway - not a problem if you don't eat I guess! I booked a "Deluxe" room - HA!!! Very small room indeed, for the life of me I can't imagine a single deluxe feature of the room. No lift - hopefully stairs are to your liking - especially with a few suitcases (makes a wonderful first impression to have to drag suitcases up 3 flights of stairs). Anyway ... stay here if you have to, but, if you can spare a few more bucks - try somewhere else - (I stayed at the Savoy - Double Bay once, $15 a night cheaper, better part of town (in fact the best part of town) and a great little hotel, had a nearby supermarket, restaurants and cinema - try that one instead.

Reviews.Title: “Its Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice now and will stay six more times this year as we go up on bussiness. We stay four nights at a time. First trip we stayed in a twin room with ensuite. The room was nicely done out and very clean but way to small. Second trip we stayed in an Appartment suite which was much larger, with a balcony and a microwave. Much more comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the place is kept to a very high standard.

HotelInfo.Name: Vulcan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Wattle Street | Ultimo, Sydney, New South Wales 2007, Australia
